We've always loved Keste and always went to their Bleeker St. location. But during this visit the Bleeker location was closed, but we weren't going to be denied our pies! So we ventured down to the FiDi to check it out and were super happy we did. They have a large and comfortable outdoor dining space (with heaters set up for the upcoming cooler weather!) and the same high quality delicious pizzas we have come to love. They have so many options, but we typically go old school margarita, spicy diovola or capriciossa and a fresh rucola salad. But their fried pizzas look great too. They also have a great wine list and the front of the house guys, especially Oscar & 'G' are fun, friendly and very professional. Go!

How does one have the best pizza in their life and gluten free at that? A Celiac's dream come true. So soft, juicy, flavorful, succulent! The wine! The host made my try 2 types before settling on the sweeter. Great chili oil as well. I will be back! Plus their bathroom is perfect for covid. The sheet covering changes every flush.

So glad when they opened one in FD, the Bleecker spot is often crowded.  We may have tried most, if not all, of the vegetarian ‘zas, so I can safely say that your meal with any of those is a sure bet.  This is my favorite Neapolitan pizza joint in the city.

Just want to preface by saying that (1) I rarely take the time to write reviews on here, and (2) I was born and raised in Italy and the only time I would rave about pizza was when I was back in Italy visiting my family......until I found Kesté.  This is the closest thing to Italian pizza I have ever come across living in NYC, and (as you can tell by the pictures) it's become a bit of a problem :)  From dining in, to delivery, to pick-up, my girlfriend and I -- and every friend I have brought here since finding it -- cannot get enough of this incredible little pizzeria. A big thank you to all of the chefs and pizzaioli for giving me a little slice of my hometown every time I'm craving pizza....which is at least 2-3x per week now.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!!!  Grazie mille, KESTÉ!

Amazing pizzas but also tasty paninis. Great value for lunch!

The Best Pizza in NYC with the always kind presence of its owner Roberto
This place really lived up to its ratings. The food was incredible and the prices for the area were very reasonable.
I will definitely recommend.

Attended an oversold Pizza Making class where there physically wasn’t room for the people who paid $90 to be there. I couldn’t see or hear a thing because I was squeezed along a brick wall at the back of the room.  My wine glass sat empty for some time and it took 30 minutes to receive water. We initially were not even served a proper amount of food for the people in the room.  The class was advertised from 7-9 pm, but because of the overselling and having to accommodate guests in groups of four to make pizzas, we didn’t wrap up until after 9:45.  At two points in the evening, one of the “special” co-hosts became aggressive toward two different customers. That was a sight to behold and made me feel super uncomfortable. I don’t believe he is a full time employee, thankfully.  The owner ended up coming by to conclude the class with an apology which included an guilt trip about how addressing the evening’s dysfunction pulled him away from a nonprofit cause/event. He literally said he’d “rather die than get a bad review” and appealed to the crowd to provide good reviews in spite of the circumstances which added to the unprofessionalism.  Here are some constructive thoughts and learnings from the above, though: -lower the max number of attendees to about half the size so everyone can see, hear, and have a reasonable amount of personal space -lower the cost per person by including a max of two glasses of wine with other glasses pay as you go -if continuing to do the goodie bag at the end, include a recipe card recapping what to do for people who can’t hear or see, or for others who are simply forgetful -Don’t draw more attention to problems than what needs to be drawn. If you know a group has an issue, speak to that group’s organizer only instead of to everyone so the event appears as seamless as possible -finally, when we met him up close, the chef seemed like a truly nice and knowledgeable person :) keep him!

(Translated by Google) It has been a pleasant resource of good Made in Italy cuisine in a city like New York, which certainly offers a lot in terms of the variety of International cuisine. We took advantage of the excellent pizza by chef Caporuscio, whose history has also moved us, but also the tasty appetizers (fantastic fried buffalo bomb) and the other courses were delicious. Kestè has the advantage of having three offices located in strategic places in Manatthan, which will give you the opportunity to take it into consideration on many occasions. The staff are very kind and helpful and the bill is adequate for the average, but if you want to save money, Kestè will give you the chance with a POPULAR MARGHERITA, a real and excellent margherita pizza for only $ 5. You got it right, only $ 5 in the face of HotDogs. Kestè keep it in mind, you won't regret it! W Italy and its courageous pioneers of taste! Kestè ha il vantaggio di avere tre sedi posizionate in luoghi strategici di Manatthan, che vi daranno possibilità di prenderla in considerazione in molte occasioni. Lo staff molto gentile e disponibile e il conto adeguato alla media, ma se volete risparmiare Kestè ve ne darà la possibilità con una MARGHERITA POPOLARE, una vera e ottima pizza margherita a soli 5$. Avete capito bene, solo 5$ alla faccia degli HotDog. Kestè tenetela in considerazione, non ve ne pentirete! W l'Italia e i suoi coraggiosi pionieri del gusto!

4.5 stars, but I'm feeling generous. :) Came here on a Sunday afternoon. Recently went gluten and dairy free, so I've been jonesing for a slice of pizza for the past couple of months. This place is very careful to avoid cross-contamination, which is great news for my friends with celiac.  The staff was nice and attentive. We ordered the gluten-free angioletti appetizer, a gluten-free marinara pie for me, and a normal marguerita for my mom. When the angiolettei came out and I sunk my teeth into the breadstick, I could not believe it was gluten-free! So fluffy and flavorful. The tomatoes and arugula were good as well, though the garlic was pretty strong in this dish.  When the pies came out, our server accidentally brought me a gluten-free marguerita instead of the marinara, but the problem was quickly rectified. When I got my pie, it looked great--nice char on the thin crust. Anybody who has toasted anything gluten-free knows how difficult it is to get char, but the ovens here get the job done! The pizza tasted perfect--the tomato sauce, garlic, olive oil, and basil all played nicely with each other, and I didn't feel like there was too much of anything on the pie. The texture had a nice, soft crunch to it, but just the right amount of pillowyness that it wasn't akin to flatbread. My mom thoroughly enjoyed her normal marguerita pie as well!  The price is about right for the food--$5 for a normal pie and gluten-free costs $4 more, but the ingredients are high quality and the portion size is generous. I was only able to eat half the pie at the restaurant, and I think this is a great place to come and split a pie with a friend.  If you find the trek to Fulton a bit arduous, there is another location on Bleecker. If that is also too far for you, then I have some good news: right now, Keste is considering making a line of frozen pizzas that can be sold in stores. Nothing is finalized yet, but that would be pretty amazing! If you're zealous for their gluten-free dough, you can call them up and ask them to send it to you, but you will have to pay for shipping and handling.  Anyway, I'm very grateful I discovered this place online, and I look forward to returning someday. :)
Lovely food

I cannot comment on the actual restaurant in this post, as I did not best here. But rather I attended a pizza making class for a friend's birthday. I will say that the hostess and waitstaff I did meet were fantastic and very cordial.  The pizza making class included two light appetizers, red or white wine, and a dessert. The instructor took the time to explain the fine mechanics behind a good and fresh pizza dough and answered questions when they came up. After the instructions, we were able to make our own pizzas using readymade dough. The instructors were helpful in explaining good form and process in stretching the dough. We even left with little goodie bags of flour and canned tomatoes!  I will say the cost of the event was a little pricey per person, however that might just be a third party cost ..not sure how much it would be to do something directly with keste.  All in all a good night!! And the pizza we made turned out delicious.
(Translated by Google) Pizza like in Naples in New York, gentle personals and professionals  (Original) Pizza come a napoli a new York personals gentle e professionals
Who doesn't love sausage and nuts. Go with the pistachio and sausage.  It's a winner
Went here with Scott’s Pizza Tour! Amazing pizza and heavenly mozzarella!! Not to mention a beautiful atmosphere!
God the best pizza ever
Ok

Food is very good, but lunch specials aren't available for take out, which they don't tell you until you go to pay and find out it's $8.72 instead of $5. Don't bother with cash as they don't do change, so if it's $8.02, e.g., and you pay with a $10, they'll give you a $1 in change.
Wonderful Magerita pizza!  Tasty antipastas.

This is a 5 star event with Toni on NY.. pairing of pizza and beer in a warm and friendly atmosphere in the heart of Wall street.  I had so much fun. And it's still ongoing. The crew was totally awesome. Everyone had fun. We made pizza. We drank beer and wine and we laughed.. the pistachio and sausage pizza is amazing. The daughter of thle owner is am amazing pizza maker. They have all kinds of varieties and gluten free options. The place is l classic in terms of pizza and fun in terms of life. Live, love and eat pizza.

Friendly and welcoming staff. Nice salads and fair pricing. That's where the fun ends. Soggy and bland pizza, don't know how the reviews could be so high. Go to Jersey, anywhere for better pies. Waiter needs to write and repeat order to get it right, and actually come back to the table once after you order. I really was hoping for something good here but left disappointed.
Amazing 😍

I gave 5 starts only because I can't give 10! This is the best pizza I had in such a long time. The pizza is made with Caputo flour, which is the best flour in Italy. The venue is cozy and nice, what else can you ask?

Just another overpriced "craft" pizza place. The menu lists a variety of special pizzas priced between $14 and $22; important to note is that these are personal-sized pizzas. They advertise a $5  pizza and there is a plain margarita pizza and a vegan version available for that price. These perhaps are the best value in the place.
Nice cozy place, has a bar and tables to sit, has happy hour time, and room to do kids birthday party
Keste is my favorite pizza! I love that the crust is thin, chewy, & charred.
Good food. Good service. Always have available seating. Good price.
A nice family dinner spot. Delicious gluten-free think crust pizza!
Difficult for the lactose intolerant
Delicious!!
Wow delicious coal fired pizza and truly Italian

Amazing place. Good history lecture on pizza. Then they teach us to make pizza. Mine was delicious...

(Translated by Google) A beautiful Italian pizzeria in the heart of the Financial District with lots of pizza academy and a table football. An authentic experience  (Original) Una bella pizzeria italiana nel cuore di Financial District con tanto di Accademia della pizza e un calcio balilla. Un'esperienza autentica

So great to see Keste expand.  Been going to the one on Bleecker Street since 2009, so when I heard about this establishment, I had to try it.  The pizza is every bit as good, the wine is on point and the service is incredible.  Be prepared to spend, but it's worth the price and then some!  For those who are more adventurous with their pizzas, I recommend the Marinara Pizza.  As you can see, it has no cheese; the first time I had one of these nine years ago, I started getting most of my pizzas from other establishments without the cheese!  The bar area is nice too and is a fun way to enjoy tasty food and a fine cocktail!

We did the Keste pizza making class for a corporate event, and were very impressed with the experience! Chef Roberto was genuine, funny, and engaging. It was a nice and relaxing activity for a group to do.
Good food, crappy seating, lazy servers.
Delicious food, waiter was lovely
My experience was below par the standards of any Italian restaurant. Staff was not so friendly either ! Food was nothing to ride home about.
Good! But can be loud and hard to find a seat
Everything is in Point
Top! True Neapolitan Pizza
The pizza is not a normal slice more rustic dough and very good they use fresh and excellent ingredients wood burning stoves
Ordered delivery, they called to say they only “stay true to menu” and are able to give a side of sauce then hung up on me.
Fantastic as authentic pizza, love it and love the atmosphere!!
My number one spot for Neapolitan style pizza

Pizza is very good and thin crust! I was there for dinner and I rally enjoyed the pizza and the selection is good. In terms of size, one pizza per person is fine. A couple of things to take into consideration, the wine list is expensive and not that vast - I suggest going with beer - and they do not allow changes to the menu (we asked to add onions to a pizza but they said it was not possible). Overall a good experience but most important, very good pizza!
Solid, well price pizza. Salad is fine too but they don’t chop the kale ceasar so you wind up chewing on some large leaf!
Delicious!!
Great authentic pizza in a nice setting. Soft drink bottles are the smallest I've ever seen though.

Well 90 second pizza is something new for me. I was here for an event and it was about one of the best. Wine kept coming with the opportunity to make my own pizza which is pretty hard and easy at the same time.  Finding this place can be a bit hard. You can easily miss this because it's not on fluton street instead on the side street. You just have to walk into the bush area and behind it or very very left of the supermarket. This place is huge thou. About 2 to 3 dining area and at least 2 bars. We were at the class area and I think they actually offer classes to make Naples pizza.  What did I learn? So Americans wheat isnt that great. Italian pizza takes only 90 seconds to make with their super wheat. Well you can do some research on that end. First the service is wonderful to all end. it's fun to listen to the chefs history, an Italian chef making it in the NYC cuisines world with no training except a passion. Total motivation for myself.  Let's talk food. I made a terrible pizza myself because too much topping from my class. Luckily the chef made something else for me :) there goes my pizza career. I will say Napoleon pizza is delicious and a lot of art goes into it. The cheese is fresh. The sauce is imported. The flour is not all purpose :). I had a fried mozzarella they served up which I had to share with the class. What a tragedy. I almost ask the waiter to get my one more for myself.  This place is really nice and I would come back again. Price can be a bit high but not compare to the quality. Just found out there are couple more keste around the city.

Outstanding Neapolitan style pizza made to order. Chef Roberto offers not only the traditional certified Neapolitan pie, he also offers a variety of deliciously creative alternatives. Signature pies can come with truffles, spicy Calabrian red peppers, eggplant, vegetables and so much more.  The restaurant can accommodate small parties of up to 8 in the front. Larger parties will most likely be moved to the sides or rear.  The back of the restaurant doubles as a pizza oven showroom and professional pizza training school.  My most recent trip serendipitously landed me at Keste as they were having the NY Pizza week launch. The place was packed with the best pizzaioli from Italy and beyond. Needless to say, the pizza and variations were amazingly good.
Enjoyed Keste GF pizza with buffalo mozzerella. Great lunch price for these generous single pizzas. Not NYC street pizza slice, but enjoyed very much.
Pizza is done the wright way
Pizza was delicious, beer was good, staffs were friendly and polite.
Pizza Napoletano! Amazing every single time. This is not your average NY slice, this is more to a traditional Naples true pizza.

As close to the life's edge of perfection in pizza as you're ever likely to experience. They somehow get the thin crust crispy but still more like bread than a cracker.  The amount of topping is just right, and everything tastes fresh and delicious.
Pricey, but food is great!
Great atmosphere..really good food. Very friendly staff. Would totally recommend this place.
Not a good pizza

Good food and great service and a really nice atmosphere. The pizza was more flat bread style while I prefer New York style loaded with cheese and toppings. But for a healthy and good meal it was great and a good price.
Had a great time
Great lunch deal, especially the gluten free pizza
Great pizza and very good service.  Take away and delivery are also good.
Good food, although in hindsight I'd get regular pizza over fried pizza. This is location is a nice space to eat with friends.

Went there for a lunch today. Pizzas were okay prices were... high and as a final touch they come with an already filled in gratuity of 20% and wait for it.... Still ask for a tip at the end !!! Lovely Do I dare to point that it was because we were tourists? No!!! Please pass
The absolute best Neapolitan pizza in the United States, no questions asked. Picture is of the Montanara - fried dough, smoked buffalo mozzarella,  and tomato sauce, THE BEST!
Everyone is friendly and offer great options based upon your taste.
Pizza, paninis, salads & tiramisu are divine.
great environment and unique zas
Excellent pizza!
Food good but mainly for the uptown crowd
Great food and very friendly owner!
(Translated by Google) excellent gluten free  (Original) excelente gluten free

The reason for my bad experience is  First The appetizers, potato croquet and the aracini with truffle. The potato croquet is basically mashed potatoes shaped like a mozzarella stick but instead of cheese, it’s not a staggering 10/10 but it’s not also a 3/10 either but a 6.5/10, just passing. Taste is quite in my opinion tasteless. Aracini with truffle is basically rice and some other things mixed up and fried like a fried ball. Also a 6.5/10, so everything is passing, what’s the dissatisfaction? The price, the truffle aracini with truffle is 6$ and the potato 3.5$ but price wouldn’t have been an issue if it wasn’t for the serving amounts. The aracini is slightly let’s say 10-20% smaller than a tennis ball. One ball btw and it’s 6$. The potato croquet is basically a mozzarella stick a bit stuffed for 3.5$.  Second Pizza is not something I would say extraordinary as it was also a passing grade. Other reviews said it was amazing but in my honest opinion is was not anything staggering. I have tasted better Neapolitan pizza. For less of price and better tasting. Ordered two pizza one was 21$ and another was 14$ but with a topping so rounding it to 17$. The ingredients wasn’t anything great, as the menu makes everything sounds amazing. The portion was good.  Third A strawberry juice was 6$. Wow damn.  Maybe I haven’t ate enough pizzas around the world to know whether it’s good or not but I can honestly say for the value, it’s not worth it. Taste wise not staggering but not bad either, pizza and the appetizers I ordered was bland. I can honestly say I’ve tasted better Neapolitan pizza that my friend brought to even that was slightly cold.  This review is purely based off of my own opinion and experience. Hope my experience helps anyone.  Reason for two stars because customer service was alright, it seems family run as well.  Thank you for reading.
Like Don Antonio, it has amazing salads and pizzas. Unlike it, it's big and spacious. When I'm in downtown NYC, I'll be there.
(Translated by Google) Excellent service and the pizzas are very delicious  (Original) Excelente servicio y las pizzas son bien deliciosas

They have an amazing happy hour here if you like Aperol Spritz or Negronis (5 PM to 7 PM during the week). And they bring free pizza out during happy hour too!  Do NOT order the special fried pizza though, it’s disgustingly oily and has a weird flavor. Everything else is great and I’d definitely come back.
Great happy hour!
This is really the best pizza in New York. Giorgia and Roberto are the best. Once you try it you understand what a real Pizza tastes like...
Pizza is always awesome!!
Awesome crust. Could not have ask for better service! The limeade is freshly made when ordered.
Overall great experience and atmosphere. Food is consistent and appetizers are great.
(Translated by Google) Authentic Italian pizza with a touch of nee york  (Original) Auntentica pizza italiana con un toque de nee york
Great gluten free pizza and beer. Just like the real thing!

The gluten free pizza crust is unrivaled in the city.  The salads, wine and fresh mozzarella are all excellent.  The prices unfortunately are off the charts.  Two salads (appetizer sized), one (individual sized) pizza, one glass of wine and a 20% tip was $70, which seems quite high.

If you want to try a pizza made as pizza is supposed to be made this is the right place. I am Italian, born and raised there. I lived in southern Italy for 30 years and go back there at least once a year. I've been in Naples twice and tasted the original "pizza napoletana" multiple times there and in Calabria and Sicily as well. I can tell you that Kesté is at the same standards. This, and the fact that the location is the financial district and they use high quality, fresh imported ingredients, partly explains why the prices might seem a bit high. Just try it though and you'll understand what I'm talking about.
Best pizza in New York City
